A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Visually stunning. This is not the Star Wars I was looking for. The Republic has vanished from existence over night with no explanation\, surely the New Republic was bigger than a handful of planets. Snoke appears as if from nowhere & no back story worthy of the back of a cigarette packet\, before exiting. The seeds planted by the Farce Awakens barely acknowledged & most ignored or the story was as explosive as a dude firework. The character DJ added nothing to the story & perhaps was just added to satisfy the actors ego?! The Mary Poppins moment was bile worthy. There was a mention of God I believe\, so I guess he/ she is now canon! Luke is portrayed as a crazy old hermit\, sound familiar? So much more could’ve been done with Luke in this episode. George Lucas may have been a weak director but his stories & world building were great. His input should’ve been sought. Perhaps it’s time for Disney to end the Jedi & kill off Deadpool while they’re at it.
